values: I still check in.  Can't figure out how to see ,more than last 10 statuses though.

Not very happy with Facebook right now.  That fucking ticker on the side apparently post every damn thing you do.  It claims it's based on the person who originally posted it, but we tested that.  It lied.  Had a friend post something "friends only".  I commented.  Anohter friend verified they saw this.  Now some people say "who cares.  Say what you want. Blah blah blah".  Yeah sure.  Except I have a lot of family on there.  It's nice I keep up with them.  But I don't want them to know my discussions about strip clubs, drinking, boobs, etc.  I was pretty happy that they finally got the filtering thing working.  That way I could post some things to people without worrying about offending my family and church friends.  but now that's fucked up.

Then to top it off a dumb ass frend of mine comments "oh was about the strip club conversation".  Well DUH! and thanks for posting it in case someone missed it the first time.  Want to mention me commenting about someone's cleavage too?
ok.  Ask me anything... blah blah blah, the 3 of y'all still on here know how it goes.

So a while back I bought some bacon salt at Kroger.  I'd pretty much forgotten about it.  Tonight I was eating some boiled eggs from Easter.  Opened up the cabinet to get out the salt, and though I'd try some Cavender's on them, and then I saw the Bacon Salt!  So I figure I'd try it.   The verdict was OH MY GOD!!!!! SOOOOOOO GOOD.

Suppose you could clone yourself at your current age.  Then for some odd reason you decided to have sexual relations with your clone.  Would it be homosexual, or masturbation?

Discuss.

Well, looks like Clear Channel finally pulled the plug.  After they came in and castrated the once great station, they appear to be surprised it has dropped to #16 in the ratings of local stations.  (Who knew there were 16 local stations? )  So they are moving their "Classic Country" station to 105.1.  They are starting a new station on 106.7 called "WTOM".  Apparently in their market research they discovered there are local stations doing well with people called "Program Directors" and personalities called "DJ" who pick out the music based on things called "requests".  They aren't really fixed to a "format".  In this case the program director will be Tom Wood. And they are going to let him and the DJ's pick out what to play.  So on a sad day, we also get some good news.  Let's just hope Clear Channel doesn't limit his play list.

But I want is really bad.
http://www.usbgeek.com/prod_detail.php?prod_id=0696

There's some other cool stuff to, but this is the best.

So I'm going to be a Werewolf for Halloween. The question is

What should I wear with it?
A. torn jeans and shirt
B. Tophat vest and cape

Wow.  It's been a whirlwind lately. Weeji and I went to watch Nightmare Before Christmas 3d on Friday.  It was very cool.  Then we went to the fair and to the rodeo.  Ate meat on a stick.  When we got home Katie was fussing and Nana was trying to calm her.  She finally calmed down and went back to the crib.  Then she fussed again Weeji took a turn.  Then I decided I'd just snuggle with her in the recliner and sleep in there.  After a while she pointed to the crib.  I got up and she proceeded to barf everywhere.  After we got that all cleaned up Nana decided to just snuggle with her on the couch.  She threw up 3 or 4 more times that night. 
   We were supposed to do Race for the Cure on Saturday, but decided to pass this year. Didn't figure she would be up to it.  Katie slept til after 8 Saturday morning. Then just say and cuddled with me in the recliner.  About 9 she decided it was time to go watch "Melmo" (Sesame Street) and was quite upset it wasn't on.  But generic cartoons soothed her.  We went and got Weeji up about 10.  Played around the house for a while.  Since she was chilly we put socks on her.  This was a mistake.  If socks go on, this means shoes go on, which means we go outside. So after a little while we decided to go for a walk.  Katie then goes to the van and pats.  Weeji and I decided to go to Wendy's then to the park.  
   At the park you would not have been able to tell she had been sick at all.  She ran and played and giggled.  After about an hour and a half she bumped her head and had a meltdown.  I picked her up and she rested her head over onto me.  She was asleep before we hit the house.
   While she napped, I loaded up the van and went to set up for the DJ gig I had at the country club. I got back just as she woke up.  And she had no energy at all. She just sat and wanted to be cuddled.  She was not happy when I had to leave.
I have 19 downloads left from E-music.  I can't think of anything to get.  Recommend me something.

(cross posted at Myspace so you don't read twice) 

 Through a strange set of events, I found myself in possession of a $45 gift card to Best Buy.  I was trying to decide what to spend it on, between a couple of box sets, 3 or 4 individual CD's, some DVD's or some memory for the computer.  So I thought about it, and came to the reazlization that I really don't want to buy CD's.  Now for those of you that know me well, you are probably as shocked as I am.  For those that don't know me very well, I'm a compulsive CD collector.  I have somewhere around 2,000-2,500.  They dominate the middle room of our house.  If I have a CD by an artist I want all CD's by that aritst, whether I listen to them or not.  Of the CD's I have there's probably a couple of hundred that I've never listened to all the way through, or even played  at all.

    Now I'm not swearing off CD's all together.  I'll still buy new albums put out by people I like.  And I'll still shop used stores some.  I'm just giving up on "completing my collections".  Sure one day I'll finish getting all the Beatles albums, and probably most of the AC/DC albums I'm missing.  But buying "Done With Mirrors" just so I'll have all the Aerosmith albums?  Probably not.  Tracking down the Jesus and Mary chain disc that I don't have, even though I have all those songs on other albums, not unless I run across it used and cheap. 

  Part of this may have been brought on by me digitizing my music, and the CD player in my car dying.  I rarely listen to a whole album anymore.  I load up my MP3 player at random and listen to it.  That way it uploads to Last.FM (Regnowsin is my user ID).  I do have a CD player (partly responsible for that Gift card, YAY extended warranty at Best Buy) that works in my car now, so that might change again, but that's where I am for now.

Cut for politics and language.

<LJ-cut>


Just heard on the news that a POLICE OFFICER had charges dropped against him because ... wait for it...   His fucking superiors didn't read the poor dumbass his rights.  Now, is it just me, or shouldn't a cop know their rights?  They only have to read it every time they arrest someone.  I'd love to hear how this went down it the courtroom.  "Nope.  They didn't read me my rights.  I know they're supposed to, because I have to.  So, since they didn't I just told them what I wanted to hear.  'Cause I knew I'd get out of it".  I fucking hate what the lawyers have done to our country.  I understand there's a fine line.  But for Christ's is there really anyone out there who was raised in USA who doesn't know their rights?  Isn't it time we stopped throwing shit out because someone didn't read it to them.  Especially when the damned person who is arrested is going "but they didn't read me my rights.  I know they're supposed to because I watch TV and movies."  Hell, they even read rights in Police Academy.  You don't even have to watch Law and Order.  I'm all for civil liberties and so forth, but if the bastard's guilty, they're guilty.  Fuck the technicalities.  Fuck the pampering.  Fuck their self esteem.  If they weren't such shitheads maybe they would have better self esteem.</lj-cut>

who designed the way Dodge secures their batteries into their cars and beat the snot out of him.  My battery died yesterday.  Which was fun.  Weeji drove me into work, and Laurie and the kids came and picked me up a little after I got off so we could go the the Alice Cooper show.  Other than the heat, the show ruled.  I'll post about it later, probably.  However once I got home I had to put the new battery in.  Well Dodge has it attached with a plate, that uses a bolt in a teeny-tiny little area.  I could barely get my hand down in there, much less a ratchet or wrench.  So I finally decide I have to go get a deep-well socket.  Not 100% sure about the size I need though.  So, being 1:00 am my choice is Wal-Mart, or Wal-Mart.  So I choose Wal-Mart.  Go over there and see the deep-well sockets.  $15.  I also see a "gator grip" socket.  Also $15. It looks like it would be deep enough, and I don't have to worry about metric or standard.  So I get it.  Get home.  It doesn't work.  So I go to the other Wal-Mart, and get the $15 set.  I also pick up the $10 extensions so I can actually use the ratchet. Once I got home with that it was not that bad to get fixed.  However it was about 2:15 am.  And STILL 90 degrees.  So I get a shower and get to bed.
  About the time I drift off Katie starts screaming.  So I get up and snuggle with her a while in the recliner.  About 2:40 I put her back in the crib and she starts screaming again.  Weeji got up with her that time, and apparently I crashed.  I woke up about 5 with a foot in my back, and was about to slap it, when I realized it was Katie.  Apparently she would not stop crying unless she was being held so Weeji went ahead and brought her in when she came back to bed.  Eventually I got her situated and snuggled with her and we went back to sleep.  It was nice.

I'm still at Alltel. Still in Advanced Tech.  It's interesting.  Some of the people you talk to are pretty cool.  Some are complete idiots.  Had one guy take 2 minutes to type in "#".  After about a minute he asked where is the number sign. So I told him <Shift> 3.  After about another minute he goes "OH! You got to hit them together!"  It was all I could do not to laugh, or say you gotta be kidding right?  

My plans for school this fall be have fallen through.  Seems the info I'd gotten from some of my coworkers that Pulaski Tech would defer tuition if you worked for Alltel were not correct.  So I'd have to come up with about $500 by Monday.  Probably work out better to wait 'til next semester anyway.

Katie is still adorable.  Although she is starting to get a little stubborn.  Even at her worst though, she's still amazingly fantastic.  Her favorite words right now are "cookie" meaning anything that goes in her mouth, including her pacifier, and "Yeah" which she says in the cutest way.  She and Weeji have been doing swim lessons the last few weeks and Katie LOVES it.  She doesn't always play along with the teacher, but has a lot of fun.

And finally on the music front, got 2 possible groups to play with, but scheduling and personnel are both hanging us up.  Both have a singer, and me on bass.  One may or may not have a guitarist and drummer.  Both are kind of on the "sure I'll play, maybe next week" sort of thing.  The other has a probable guitarists and drummer, and maybe practice space, we just have to actually get together.  I'm basically hanging back to see what happens.

So some of you may know I want a gorilla tattoo. The problem is finding one I like. I have done some digging and come up with a few. Let me know which y'all like. Really like this one All the way to the bottom This is more the pose I was looking for, but want a little more detail
I totally thought I sent that yesterday, but apparently closed my tab before submitting.  Sorry I'm lame.

Since my last post work has gotten much better.  I am now working a respectable 11-8 shift in Advanced Tech Support.  This is dealing with Blackberry's, Palm Treo's , Data Cards, and using cellphones as modems.  It definitely more advanced and a lot harder, but more laid back at the same time.  The people are cool.  I'm not the geekiest one up here.  Might even be playing some music with a couple of them.  YAY!!!!


On the Katie front, she's getting so big.  She loves being outside, and shakes her head whenever you ask her anything (except "do you want to go out side" which she responds to by running to the door and beating on it.)

She is so amazing.  More later.  It's lunch time.
Is it just me, or is LJ being a little janky today?

I've calmed down a little after my last post and am feeling better now.

<lj-cut text="Work related profanity warning">
OK.  So today was "shift bid" at work. This is where we pick out our shifts for next schedule. I've been looking forward to this with the idea I might be able to see Weeji and Katie next bid.  However instead I got bent over the table and fisted up to the elbow.  Now, you might think, surely it's not that bad. Yeah, how does fuckin' 5pm to 2 am sound? Now the only thing that makes this a little less shitty is that I have Friday and Saturday off.  My only other choices were decent hours, but working both weekend days. What really pissed me off is that I picked 41 out of 70.  I bust my ass, and do a good job.  I looked at the "Key perfomance indicators" that they listed as what they used to pick the order.  I can't figure out how the fuck I got that low.  One of the guys who picked in the top 5 was way lower than me on 2 of the 6, the same on 2 of the 6 and only slighty higher on the other 2.  Some of my teammates who had almost identical stats were 20 people or more above me.  So I am back on the job market again.  I hate it, because I like Alltel, and like my job.  But I can't fuckin work that.  And to complete my night, Katie just pissed all over me. </lj-cut>
Ok this song actually made me smile a bit.

I really got nothing.  Been looking back a little lately, partially thanks to Albee.  It just makes me want to make music even more, but I may be working on something on that front.  I'll let y'all know if anything developes for sure.

Katie keeps getting bigger.  She's almost talking now.  I don't know if she actually means it, but she will kinda say "hi" and she definitely says mama and dada.  She's quite amazing.


Also it was great to see Albee, Pixystixfairy, and the G-man a couple of Sundays ago.  Hopefully we can get together again soon for a little longer, and when our clan isn't recovering from sickness.

'Course in reality this is just an excuse to post a new icon.

I just saw a campaign poster for Rebekah Kennedy.  Didn't notice what she was running for.  And for those of you that know her that are thinking, "not that Rebekah Kennedy" there was a pic on the poster.  Yes it is.

So I'm on lunch and bored so here goes.  Work is still going really well.  Except for the fact that I only get to see Weeji in the morning when she's rushing aroung to get to work.  I am loving the mornings with Katie.  I usually hang out with her 'til 8:30 or 9 then take her in.  Part of me feels bad about not keeping her longer, but I also figure we're paying for the daycare might as well use it.  I'm still recovering from out house being robbed.  It hit Weeji a lot worse since the main thing they took was her jewelry (including a lot with emotional value).  They also got the PS2 and most of our games.  I've got to get a hold of the insurance company tomorrow to see how to file a claim. Went up to see mom and dad this weekend.  Both are doing well.  Mom is recovering great (she had to have a masectomy).  Katie had a great time.

So I don't post much.  As most of y'all who know me personally know I generally don't discuss much (except music).  Anyway, here goes:

Katie's getting bigger and bigger.  She pulls up when we're hold her hands, and wants to crawl so bad it seriously pisses her off when she can't.  But she's so adorable.

Job-wise I'm doing tech support for Alltel cellular.  If you have Alltel and your phone screws up, you may get to talk to me.  The pay's good, the benefits are great, the job's easy and interesting.  The only down side is the hours completely blow.  Other than that I love it.

Also I've got a DJ gig tomorrow night and at least one more for the year, which will put me making a little bit of a profit after buying all new gear and a crapload of CD's.  This means hopefully with out tax return I can get a laptop and external harddrive this year to save my back a little pain.

That's about all I got for now.
Just add about 100lbs.
Hour lunches suck.  Well, not all the time, but it suck to have to take one when I'd much rather come in 1/2 hour later.  I'm bored, bored, bored.

In a weird sort of way.
